goodResponse.fullResponse:
✦ PARABLE: The Lost Sheep (Luke 15:3-7)

↗ The Story (Brief Retelling)
• A shepherd has 100 sheep, but one wanders away
• He leaves the 99 in safety and searches everywhere for the lost one
• When he finds it, he celebrates with joy and calls his friends to rejoice with him

↗ Original Audience & Context
• Jesus told this to Pharisees and teachers who criticized Him for eating with tax collectors and sinners
• They believed God only cared about "righteous" people, not outcasts
• Jesus was defending His ministry to society's rejected people

↗ Core Spiritual Lesson
• God actively pursues every lost person with relentless love
• Heaven rejoices more over one sinner who repents than 99 people who don't need repentance
• No one is too far gone for God's grace

↗ Modern-Day Example
• Like a parent who stays up all night searching for a missing child
• Or a teacher who gives extra attention to a struggling student
• God doesn't write anyone off - He pursues the lost, broken, and forgotten with the same intensity
